p: According to Senatore et al., and using the same classical extraction method, linalool (36.5%) and linalyl acetate (16.3%) were found as the most abundant component in the Turkish myrtle essential oil, with other compounds in representative amount being 1,8-cineole (10.5%), geranyl acetate (8.0%), α-terpineol (7.9%), and α-pinene (7.8%) [ 39].
